data.title: Import/Export syntax highlighter (and possibly UI) themes
data.body:
This would let users share their own themes, also could make it possible to bundle popular syntax highlighting themes (Monokai, Solarized) and UI colors (Blender, Ubuntu) with Godot, with easy switching.

Basically, this would add an export button in the editor settings that exports the colours to a standard format, which you can then import.

data.title: Tilemap hotkeys
data.body: The (hidden) hotkeys for editing of tilemaps currently are 'a' (x-mirror), 's' (y-mirror), and 'd' (duplicate). It would be nice if there were some shortcuts for rotation (e.g. rotate left/right) and/or transpose.

data.title: Changed popup_centered by popup_centered_minsize in editor dialogs
Editor dialogs now fit to labels
data.body:
Simple addition to make accept dialogs fit to their labels. To prevent ugly labels out of their window bounds.

I think it fixes issue #1607.

data.body: ![](http://i.imgur.com/O0Vd3Xk.png)

data.title: Add a tab into the Debugger panel to view Arrays content
data.body:
Hi,

It could be useful if there was a mean to see the content of array variables into the Debugger panel.

data.title: Don't uncamelcase str containing underscore
data.body:
Currently, `"test_AABB_collision"` is uncamelcased to `"test_A_A_B_B_collision"`.

So I propose that `String::camelcase_to_underscore()` ignores strings already containing an underscore.

data.title: Collision exceptions for KinematicBody2D to KinematicBody2D do not work.
data.body: While working on a demo SHMUP I found that the add_collision_exception_with() method will not work with KinematicBody2D to KinematicBody2D collisions. It's easy enough to use other PhysicsBody2D nodes but I believe that the  KinematicBody2D is less CPU/resource intensive.

data.title: Audio glitching on Android
data.body:
Pops and clicks happen randomly when playing sounds.
Probably, this is a buffer underrun problem.
Different samplerates make things worse.
The problem is described here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21184979/playing-generative-sound-with-opensl
and 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14842803/low-latency-audio-playback-on-android
and maybe this presentation will be of help:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=d3kfEeMZ65c
This site is all about the topic:
https://code.google.com/p/high-performance-audio/

data.title: About project setting
data.body:
I can't find a 'save' button in project setting dialog's general page.
I find a  'save' button in project setting dialog's Input Map page.
how to save the config I make in general page?

data.title: can't push_back on concatenated sub-array
data.body:
Hi,

Win32 current vanilla compiled version using MSVC2010.

The func below should print : "123, 456, 789, END, 456", but instead it prints "123, 456, 456". 

This is because the two last `push_back()` have no effect on the sub-array that was used as destination for the concatenation :

```
func minimalized_failing_code(): #{

    var A = [ [123] , [456] ]

    A[ 0 ] += A[ 1 ]  # <== faulty buggy concatenation

    A[ 0 ].push_back(789)
    A[ 0 ].push_back("END")

    print( A ) # <== should print "123,456,789,END,456", but prints "123,456,456"
#}
```

If concatenate  A[0] and A[1] using a loop, it works like expected :

```
func minimalized_reference_code(): #{

    var A = [[123],[456]]

    for x in A[ 1 ]:
        A[ 0 ].push_back(x)

    A[ 0 ].push_back(789)
    A[ 0 ].push_back("END")

    print(A) # <== prints "123,456,789,END,456" like expected
#}
```

data.title: Update the bundled google play services package
data.body:
Can you update the google play services package.
If you have the android SDK update that to the latest version then copy
ANDROID_SDK_FOLDER/extras/google/google_play_services

that folder and overwrite the one in
GODOT_SRC/platform/android/libs/google_play_services

data.title: test_gdscript.cpp does not handle OPCODE_ASSERT
windows' fix for issues #1357 and #1636 : delayed MouseWheel button release events
data.body:
This makes BUTTON_WHEEL_UP/DOWN readable like any other mouse button
using `Input.is_mouse_button_pressed()` or `Input.is_action_pressed()`.

It simulates a delay between the "mousewheel press" event and the fake
"mousewheel release" event.

**I describe the intended behavior here, so it could be easily
reimplemented for other platforms :**

The fake release event is scheduled to occurs 100ms after the press
event, which makes it catchable into any gdscript process function (as
long as the delta is smaller than 100ms indeed).

WheelUp and WheelDown cancel each others by immediately triggering an
early release event if one was scheduled. Overlapping WheelUp and
WheelDown is thus impossible.

If several "WheelUp press" (or several "WheelDown press") events occurs
in less than 100ms, the matching release event is simply postponed to
occur 100ms after the last "wheel press" event.

The states of the BUTTON_WHEEL_UP/DOWN are also accessible through
Input.get_mouse_button_mask() respectively as bits 4 and 5.

**What behavior does it change into the Editor ?**

The only change I have noticed is that when you mouse-wheel over the 2D
or 3D viewports, it zooms in and out into two half steps instead of just
one. But this behavior was already happening before this patch. It's
just that it was not noticeable because there was no delay between the
press event and the fake release event.

**TODO (by someone else) :**
- reimplement it on Linux and MacOS
- then, add `BUTTON_MASK_WHEEL_UP = 4` and `BUTTON_MASK_WHEEL_DOWN = 5`
  into `input_event.h` and bind them into `globals_constants.cpp`.
- replace the FAKE_MOUSEWHEEL_RELEASE_DELAY_IN_TICKS constant by a
  project setting to allow to choose the fake release delay

it fixes #1357 and #1636 for windows platform only.

data.title: PR : fixes printraw to make it actually print raw
data.body:
Hi,
According to the doc, printraw() is not supposed to add any extra carriage return.

data.title: Light icon in 3D view is low-resolution
data.body:
The light icon in the 3D view is low-resolution, which makes it ugly. I'm using a 19201080 screen. It also has visible clipping (because a non-fully transparent pixel touches the edge of the image).

_Click on the image to enlarge it._

![Image](https://lut.im/vGZAe5UQ/qNo27TpW)

data.title: RAM usage gradually increases with the presence of sprites with bones
data.body:
System: Windows 8.1 x64

I found this after left my computer stopped for a while. When I returned, I realized that the system was slower. I checked the task manager and saw that Godot was using more than 2GB of RAM.

After closed everything and reopen the project, while monitored the memory, I noticed the RAM usage keeps growing gradually, even without performing any action on Godot. After start trying to isolate the issue, I concluded that the guilty was the 2D bone system.

data.title: Input Map, wheel up/down not reported by Input.is_action_pressed()
data.body:
Hi,

Into the project settings Input Map, it is possible to define actions that uses Wheel Up / Down.
But Wheel Up /Down are not reported by Input.is_action_pressed() when they occur.

Probably related to what you explained in #1357.

data.title: Wiki: licensing FAQ
data.body:
In order to help against legal uncertainty when making games (and other stuff), I've written a licensing FAQ page (attribution is appreciated but not required). I am pretty sure (but not 100 % sure) the content is valid.

(Note that I'm not a lawyer professionally, I'm just someone who studies copyright as an hobby.)

Could you add this to the wiki, please? This uses Markdown formatting.

``` Markdown
**DISCLAIMER: this is not legal advice.**

This page lists common questions about the licensing of Godot and possible uses.

Q: Can I use Godot in my FLOSS project?
============================================

A: **Of course!**
This is encouraged so that people can learn about Godot and study how it works.

Q: Can I use Godot in my commercial project?
=================================================

A: **Yes, you can.**
Anyone is free to use Godot for both commercial and non-commercial purposes. There are no royalties to pay.

Q: Can I use Godot in my proprietary project?
==================================================

A: **Yes, you can.**
You are not required to release the source code or the assets of your project.

Q: Do I have to release my changes to the source code?
======================================================

A: **You don't have to release your changes**.
This means you don't *have* to contribute to Godot upstream, although your help is appreciated.

Q: Which licenses can I use for my code?
========================================

A: **In case you release the source code, almost any software license is valid.**
It is recommended to use the MIT license or CC0 (public domain waiver)
as it allows us to benefit from your changes and additions (ie. merge them upstream),
but you can also use Apache, BSD, GPL or LGPL (any version) if you desire.

Note that Creative Commons licenses (other than CC0) are **not recommended** for software.
Please refrain from using them on code, however you can use them on assets just fine.

Q: Which licenses can I use for my assets?
==========================================

A: **Any license can be used for your assets**, including but not limited to:

* Creative Commons licenses,
* Public domain waivers (CC0, Unlicense, ),
* The MIT license (of course),
* Your own custom, proprietary license,
* 

Q: Am I allowed to remove the Godot splash screen? In other words, do I have to provide prominent attribution?
==============================================================================================================

A: **Yes.**
The splash screen is not required. No *prominent* attribution is required,
however a mention of Godot engine in your project's credits and/or website is appreciated.

Q: Do I grant a license to Godot developers over my project?
=========================================================

A: **No, your project stays yours.**
```

Feel free to correct me, or to suggest new questions to add. You can paste the Markdown code [here](http://markdownlivepreview.com/) for a preview of how it would look on the wiki.

data.body:
It seams Godot can't get the local certificates to verify a host.

similar to #1626

```
Cause: unable to get local issuer certificate
CERT STR: /C=US/O=DigiCert Inc/CN=DigiCert SHA2 Secure Server CA
VALID: 0
CONNECTION RESULT: -1
SSL! TURNED ON!
```

data.title: Can't add_child
data.body:
I create hierarchy with:
- parent
  - child1

In child1 had this script:

```
extends Node

func _ready():
    var parent      = get_node("..")
    var nodeTest    = Node.new()
    nodeTest.set_name("nodeTest")
    parent.add_child(nodeTest)
    print(parent.get_name(), " child = ", parent.get_child_count())
    var i
    for i in range(parent.get_child_count()):
        print(parent.get_child(i).get_name())
```

When run output showed:

```
parent child = 1
child1
```

It not add child in to parent node.

data.title: Some automation for creating templates when building Android (armeabi) on Linux
data.body:
- Should be easy enough to extend to other platforms, but I have no way to
  test others currently and am uncertain of the template location convention for
  platforms other than posix/Linux
- Moves the android lib built (following the library naming expected by android
  libgodot_android.so) to the LIB_INSTALL_PATH:
  platform/android/java/libs/armeabi/.
  - Will need to some modifications to work
    with other architectures
- creates the APK template symlink in ~/.godot/templates/

data.title: Fixes issue #1604 (accelerometer malfunctioning on some devices)
data.body: Resolves the issue of the accelerometer behaving differently across devices with landscape as default and devices with portrait as default.
